conclusion: Plan to solve for temperature at state A given temperature at state C is 300K
Three states A, B, C connected by a curve on the p-V diagram
State C is at approximately (2 × 10^-3 m³, 5 × 10⁵ Pa)
State A is at approximately (5 × 10^-3 m³, 3 × 10⁵ Pa)
State B is at approximately (6 × 10^-3 m³, 2 × 10⁵ Pa)
Explanation of variables in ideal gas law
nR is constant since mass of gas is constant
Calculate nR using state C: nR = (5 × 10⁵ Pa × 2 × 10^-3 m³)/300K = 10/3 J/K
Calculate temperature at state A: T_A = (3 × 10⁵ Pa × 5 × 10^-3 m³) / (10/3 J/K) = 450K
Final answer: Temperature of gas in state A is 450K
